name: Git Collaboration & GitHub
description: Master team collaboration workflows with Git and GitHub including pull requests, code reviews, and team management

definitions.beginner: Git collaboration involves working with other developers on the same project using remote repositories. GitHub provides tools like pull requests, issues, and code reviews to coordinate team development and maintain code quality.
definitions.advanced: Git collaboration leverages distributed version control architecture with remote repositories serving as synchronization points. GitHub enhances this with web-based collaboration features including pull request workflows, protected branches, CODEOWNERS files, and automated checks that enforce code quality and review processes in enterprise development environments.

troubleshooting.problem: Pull request conflicts with main branch
troubleshooting.solution: Rebase feature branch onto latest main before submitting PR
troubleshooting.details: Keep feature branches up-to-date with main to avoid complex merge conflicts

troubleshooting.problem: Accidentally pushed sensitive data to repository
troubleshooting.solution: Remove from history using git filter-branch or BFG Repo-Cleaner
troubleshooting.details: Change any exposed credentials immediately and notify team members

troubleshooting.problem: PR build checks failing on CI/CD pipeline
troubleshooting.solution: Run tests locally and fix issues before pushing updates
troubleshooting.details: Ensure all automated checks pass before requesting review

troubleshooting.solution: Pull latest changes first, then push your commits
troubleshooting.details: Remote has updates that aren't in your local repository

troubleshooting.problem: Large binary files causing repository bloat
troubleshooting.solution: Use Git LFS for large files and remove existing large files from history
troubleshooting.details: Configure .gitattributes for LFS and use external storage for large assets
